basics.name: Simulator Technician
basics.label: Electronic Technician / Avionics Specialist
basics.summary: Experienced Electronic Technician with extensive knowledge in A/C and D/C theory and troubleshooting skills and technique. Avionics specialist in theory of operation and repairs.

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Flight instruments Installation and repair. Installing avionics LRU's and Flight gauges on flight line. Interpretation of blueprints and schematics. Installation of Avionics equipment.
highlights: Worked to meet current FAA electrical codes and company guidelines
Installed wiring and electrical appliances with a 40% ahead-of-schedule rate
Supervised team of three staff members

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Maintained CRJ-700,900 IAW FAA standards and procedures. Repaired and replaced Avionics equipment for proper functionality of aircraft.

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Wire Stamping and Cannon plug Termination and routing. Installation of wire bundles and termination of grounding blocks. Boeing 737, Airbus A320.

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Avionic flight line repairs and modifications on CH-47 chinooks and UH-60 blackhawks. Avionics maintenance supervisor OIF 2009.
highlights: Supervised operation and maintenance of systems

courses: Coursework in A/C And D/C Emphasis onTheory
Coursework in Meteorology, Air Traffic Regulations and Air Navigation
Coursework in High-Voltage Cable Splicing, Qualified Rigging and Signaling
Coursework in DC Electricity, AC Electricity and Electronics Theory
